holidays.name: International Waffle Day 🧇
holidays.description: Celebrate the delicious and golden waffle! Waffle fans unite to enjoy this crispy, fluffy breakfast treat in all sorts of creative ways.
holidays.origin: Inspired by the feast day of the Annunciation in Sweden where waffles were traditionally eaten to break Lent, International Waffle Day honors this tasty tradition.
holidays.funFact: In Sweden, letting the word 'waffle' slip while praying used to be considered blasphemous because of the close association to their holy day!

holidays.name: National Tolkien Reading Day 📚🧙
holidays.description: A day to dive back into the epic worlds created by J.R.R. Tolkien—Middle-earth adventures with hobbits, elves, and wizards galore.
holidays.origin: Started by Tolkien fans to commemorate the anniversary of the publication of 'The Hobbit' and to promote reading and appreciation of Tolkien’s works.
holidays.funFact: Tolkien crafted entire languages and histories for his characters, making him a linguistic genius as well as a storyteller.

holidays.name: National Sheep Cheese Day 🧀🐑
holidays.description: Say cheese! This quirky food holiday celebrates cheeses made from sheep's milk, like Manchego and Roquefort—creamy, tangy, and utterly delicious.
holidays.origin: A foodie favorite day to explore less common cheeses, highlighting the unique flavors sheep's milk brings to cheese crafting.
holidays.funFact: Sheep’s milk has more fat and protein than cow’s milk, making sheep cheese richer and often tastier!

holidays.name: Teacher's Day (Czech Republic & Slovakia) 👩‍🏫📚
holidays.description: Dedicated to honoring educators and their crucial role in society, this day coincides with the birthday of John Amos Comenius, the father of modern education.
holidays.origin: Comenius was a 17th-century Czech philosopher and educator who significantly shaped teaching methods and advocated universal education.
holidays.funFact: Comenius wrote one of the first picture books for children and believed education should be joyful and accessible to all.
